chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
v: nat -> R
u: nat -> R

Goal:
(forall n : nat, u n = v n) -> ex_lim_seq u -> ex_lim_seq v

Premises:
ex_lim_seq = fun u : nat -> R => exists l : Rbar, is_lim_seq u l : (nat -> R) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
ex_lim_seq_ext_loc : forall u v : nat -> R, eventually (fun n : nat => u n = v n) -> ex_lim_seq u -> ex_lim_seq v
is_lim_seq_ext : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), (forall n : nat, u n = v n) -> is_lim_seq u l -> is_lim_seq v l
is_LimInf_seq_ext : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), (forall n : nat, u n = v n) -> is_LimInf_seq u l -> is_LimInf_seq v l
Lim_seq_ext_loc : forall u v : nat -> R, eventually (fun n : nat => u n = v n) -> Lim_seq u = Lim_seq v
is_LimInf_seq_ext_loc : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), eventually (fun n : nat => u n = v n) -> is_LimInf_seq u l -> is_LimInf_seq v l
is_lim_seq_ext_loc : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), eventually (fun n : nat => u n = v n) -> is_lim_seq u l -> is_lim_seq v l
is_LimSup_seq_ext_loc : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), eventually (fun n : nat => u n = v n) -> is_LimSup_seq u l -> is_LimSup_seq v l
ex_lim_LimSup_LimInf_seq : forall u : nat -> R, ex_lim_seq u < -> LimSup_seq u = LimInf_seq u
is_LimInf_seq = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, (forall N : nat, exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ u n < l0 + eps) /\ (exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> l0 - eps < u n) | p_infty => forall M : R, exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> M < u n | m_infty => forall (M : R) (N : nat), exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ u n < M end : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_LimSup_seq = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, (forall N : nat, exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ l0 - eps < u n) /\ (exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> u n < l0 + eps) | p_infty => forall (M : R) (N : nat), exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ M < u n | m_infty => forall M : R, exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> u n < M end : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
cv_infty_cv_R0 : forall Un : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, Un n <> 0) -> cv_infty Un -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => / Un n) 0
is_LimSup_opp_LimInf_seq : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_LimSup_seq (fun n : nat => - u n) (Rbar_opp l) < -> is_LimInf_seq u l
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0%nat -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
AlembertC3_step1 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R), x <> 0 -> (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Pser An x l}
Alembert_C2 : forall An : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
Alembert_C4 : forall (An : nat -> R) (k : R), 0 <= k < 1 -> (forall n : nat, 0 < An n) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) k -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
Init.Nat.pred = fun n : nat => match n with | 0%nat => n | S u => u end : nat -> nat Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Alembert_C6 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x k : R), 0 < k -> (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) k -> Rabs x < / k -> {l : R | Pser An x l}
Alembert_C5 : forall (An : nat -> R) (k : R), 0 <= k < 1 -> (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) k -> {l : R | Un_cv (fun N : nat => sum_f_R0 An N) l}
is_LimSup_LimInf_lim_seq : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_LimSup_seq u l -> is_LimInf_seq u l -> is_lim_seq u l
sum_eq_R0 : forall (An : nat -> R) (N : nat), (forall n : nat, (n <= N)%nat -> An n = 0) -> sum_f_R0 An N = 0
is_lim_LimInf_seq : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq u l -> is_LimInf_seq u l
is_lim_LimSup_seq : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq u l -> is_LimSup_seq u l
is_LimSup_seq_unique : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_LimSup_seq u l -> LimSup_seq u = l
is_LimInf_seq_unique : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_LimInf_seq u l -> LimInf_seq u = l
ex_LimInf_seq : forall u : nat -> R, {l : Rbar | is_LimInf_seq u l}
ex_LimSup_seq : forall u : nat -> R, {l : Rbar | is_LimSup_seq u l}
Un_cv = fun (Un : nat -> R) (l : R) => forall eps : R, eps > 0 -> exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (n >= N)%nat -> R_dist (Un n) l < eps : (nat -> R) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
infinite_sum = fun (s : nat -> R) (l : R) => forall eps : R, eps > 0 -> exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (n >= N)%nat -> R_dist (sum_f_R0 s n) l < eps : (nat -> R) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
eventually = fun P : nat -> Prop => exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> P n : (nat -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
Pser = fun (An : nat -> R) (x l : R) => infinite_sum (fun n : nat => An n * x ^ n) l : (nat -> R) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope]
LimSup_seq = fun u : nat -> R => proj1_sig (ex_LimSup_seq u) : (nat -> R) -> Rbar Argument scope is [function_scope]
LimInf_seq = fun u : nat -> R => proj1_sig (ex_LimInf_seq u) : (nat -> R) -> Rbar Argument scope is [function_scope]
cv_infty = fun Un : nat -> R => forall M : R, exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> M < Un n : (nat -> R) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
is_lim_seq = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => filterlim u eventually (Rbar_locally l) : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
sum_eq : forall (An Bn : nat -> R) (N : nat), (forall i : nat, (i <= N)%nat -> An i = Bn i) -> sum_f_R0 An N = sum_f_R0 Bn N
Lim_seq = fun u : nat -> R => Rbar_div_pos (Rbar_plus (LimSup_seq u) (LimInf_seq u)) {| pos := 2; cond_pos := Rlt_R0_R2 |} : (nat -> R) -> Rbar Argument scope is [function_scope]
lt = fun n m : nat => (S n <= m)%nat : nat -> nat -> Prop Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
INR_le : forall n m : nat, INR n <= INR m -> (n <= m)%nat
le_INR : forall n m : nat, (n <= m)%nat -> INR n <= INR m

```coq
intros u v Huv Hulim.
unfold ex_lim_seq in *.
destruct Hulim as [l Hu].
exists l.
apply is_lim_seq_ext with (u := u); auto.
Qed.```

original: intros u v Huv Hulim. unfold ex_lim_seq in *. destruct Hulim as [l Hu]. exists l. apply is_lim_seq_ext with (u := u); auto.
